newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore Refining Co shuts crude unit.
newsitem.headline: Singapore Refining Co shuts crude unit.

text.p: Singapore Refining Company (SRC) has shut its 60,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) crude distillation unit for a one-week unscheduled maintenance starting October 1, sources said on Wednesday.
Repairs work are ongoing at the moment and the refinery hopes to restart operations by the weekend, the sources said.
They said the crude unit had run some crude supplies that did not meet the refinery's required specification causing technical problems.
When the problems started, the unit was running under its normal operating rate, the sources said.
This forced the refinery to shut the unit for inspection and repairs, they said.
The refinery located at Singapore's south-western island of Pulau Merlimau has a total capacity of 285,000 bpd.
It is 40 percent owned by Singapore Petroleum Company with the remaining stakes divided equally between British Petroleum and Caltex.
Caltex is a joint venture between Texaco Inc and Chevron Corp.
